primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God saves and leads a rebellious, idolatrous people to the Promised Land by providing a mediator and a 'shield' against His own consuming holiness.

tekstueel_bewijs: God has forged him into a mighty leader
God permits Moses to refract his fierce, dazzling holiness
God proves his love for us
saved through him from the wrath of God

zender.identificatie: The Holy God (I AM WHO I AM)
tekstueel_bewijs: the God who is really God
the flame of his righteous wrath

ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is forced to identify with the Receiver (the sinner) rather than the Subject.

tekstueel_bewijs: Moses... ready to take his place alongside the worst of sinners
a greater One than Moses is here
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who provides the Helper (Christ).

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin/Idolatry and the Divine Wrath it provokes
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just 'bad habits' but a 'consuming fire' and 'annihilating holiness' that renders the human subject helpless.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human attempt to manufacture security through 'The Market' or 'Gods of Gold'.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The People/CEOs/Hearers
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The failure of the secondary program (the market collapse) exposes the need for the primary program (grace).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has forged him into a mighty leader
God proves his love for us
voorbeelden_mens_subject: they have made for themselves gods of gold
we will reflect upon the ephemeral nature
they sat down to eat and drink

voorbeelden: they deserve whatever happens to them
we wouldn’t mind getting just a little piece of it
we do not know what has become of him

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on human INABILITY (non-pouvoir) and God's POWER to save. It moves from the 'cannot' of idols to the 'can' of the Mediator.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From ~S1 (Idolatry) to S2 (Wrath), then resolving through ~S2 (The Shield/Christ) to S1 (Mercy).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension between God's holiness and man's sin is resolved not by human improvement, but by a 'Shield' (Christ) provided by God.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; God's holiness is described as 'annihilating'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It identifies the human condition as 'helpless' and 'ungodly,' positioning God as the sole initiator of salvation.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: this man has become ready to take his place alongside the worst of sinners

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God proves his love for us in that while we still were sinners Christ died for us.
his own unmediated presence would consume them

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Moses is used not as a moral example for us to copy, but as a 'type' or 'revelation' of how God works through a mediator.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: Moses' intercession is a reflection of God's own mercy.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; the hearer is 'shielded' rather than 'recruited'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; God does the work, man receives the benefit.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 2008 financial crisis to the Exodus narrative and finally to the Cross is seamless and structurally sound.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Christ died for the ungodly... justified by his blood.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses more on the work of the Son and the Father; the Spirit's role is implicit in the 'shielding' and 'presence'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Fatal; sin provokes a 'consuming fire' that requires a divine shield.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is powered by God's action. Humans are actantially 'Receivers' of a 'Object' (Salvation) they cannot produce.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a classic grace structure.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject. It avoids the trap of turning Moses into a hero to be imitated, instead using him as a window into the character of God.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the irony of the golden calf; Greimas shows that the 'engine' is the transfer of the Object from Sender to Receiver via a Mediator.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the text; semiotics explains how the sermon's 'world' functions and who holds the power.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the 'Shield' is a necessary actantial Helper to protect the Receiver from the Sender's own nature (Holiness).

appendices.notities: The sermon effectively uses the 2008 financial crisis as a 'Secondary Program' that fails, driving the narrative toward the 'Primary Program' of the Gospel.
